Hi all,

 

This year I will be doing kodogu and koshirae with Jim's help. I will
certainly have a number of pieces that have genuine uttori overlays with me.
So, we can continue the Tampa discussion in SF. I have expanded my Ko-Mino
collection, so there will be a chance to compare Ko-Mino, Ko-Kinko and
Ko-Goto pieces as well. 

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Ron Hartmann [mailto:swords@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 01, 2005 1:31 AM
To: TOKEN; nihontostudy; nihonto@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] identifying utori technique

 

Another topic which we discussed awhile ago was to understand and recognize
the use of gold utori overlay on fittings, what is true "utori" and what is
not. 

Jim Gilbert mentioned recently that he plans to be at the Tampa show this
year if all goes well. I don't recall just who all became involved in our
on-line discussion of "utori" but I for one, plan on bringing along a few
examples of what "I" call utori and also a few examples of what I have my
doubts about being "true" utori technique. Keep this in mind and if we can
gather a few of us together for a short while that weekend, maybe with Jim's
leadership we could all learn something about "utori" work. I will have a
table to sit down at or if not there, certainly a quiet corner can be found
somewhere there. I for one look forward to some discussion on this topic!

Ron
STL
